description: Change of use to ground floor from medical centre (D1 Use Class) to a self-contained residential flat (C3 Use Class) including associated amenity space, refuse storage and cycle storage provision; front boundary treatment and external alterations to remove a window within the rear façade, replace a window with a door in the rear façade, and replace a door with a window within the side facade
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s) Location Plan scale 1:1250 ref. SK-1034-1; Existing Ground Floor Plan ref. 1034-1 rev A; Proposed Ground Floor Plan ref. 1034-3 rev B; Existing and Proposed Elevations ref. 1034-4 rev B; Site Plan ref. 1034-5 rev A; Existing and Proposed Elevations ref. 1034-7; Planning Statement ref. BMD/1034 dated June 2017.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, in the interest of proper planning.
| Notwithstanding the details shown on the plans, all external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building on this site.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies 7.4 & 7.6 of the London Plan (2016) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).
| Ensure refuse and recycling storage are provided and brought into use prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
| A minimum of two cycle parking spaces shall be provided and located in secure undercover lockable compounds, prior to the first occupation of the development permitted and retained thereafter.

Reason:  In the interests of highway and pedestrian safety in accordance with policies 1.1 f of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policy 6.9 and 6.13 of the London Plan (2016), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| The development hereby approved must be provided with filtered fresh air ventilation system capable of mitigating elevated concentrations of nitrogen oxides in the external air. The ventilation system shall be completed prior to first occupation of the 2 no. flats and shall be retained permanently thereafter.

Reason: In the interests of the internal environment of the development in accordance with SPG10: Noise & Vibration; policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012); policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013), policy 7.14 of the London Plan (2016) and National Planning Policy Framework (2012).

| Building envelope insulation for the approved residential building, with windows shut and other means of ventilation provided, shall be installed to achieve the internal noise targets adopted by the Local Planning Authority:
a.	Bedrooms (23.00-07.00 hrs) 30 dB LAeq and 45 dB Lmax (fast).
b.	Living rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 35 dB LAeq.
c.	Kitchens, bathrooms, WC and utility rooms (07.00-23.00 hrs) 45 dB LAeq.
The sound insulation measures shall be installed and fully completed prior to the first occupation of the 2 no. flats and maintained thereafter.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016), policy 1.1 (j) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (adopted 2012), policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (adopted 2013) and SPG10: Noise and Vibration.
| No part of roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), and policy 5.16 of the London Plan (2016).
